item.title: Info
item.description: I read once that the human mind never runs out of storage space – we forget only what we cannot retrieve. “caught in pointers” is an exhibition of analog & digital print-based artwork by Andrew CS, created in parallel to their debut album of the same name. pointers (*) index the world in RAM - we carry them in pockets & phone cases & microphones. throughout our time-paths - unable to collapse the infinity of a moment to megabytes, we form indices of what we cherish.
